CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03B02

TITLE.P: 169-BYM-2017 Framework Agreement for Artificial Grass System.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority s responsible for the planning, development, management and operation of municipal urban spaces in Oslo. The urban spaces include communal areas such as roads and streets, squares, meeting places, parks, recreational areas, municipal sports and recreation facilities and municipal landscape areas in Marka and inner Oslofjord. Hereunder the Contracting Authority manages approx. 100 artificial grass pitches of varying sizes. Each year the Contracting Authority carries out new construction and rehabilitation of artificial grass pitches that are primarily used by different sports clubs in the municipality. In order to cover the need for delivery and installation of different artificial grass systems, the Contracting Authority shall enter into parallel framework agreements with 2 to 3 tenderers.

Each year the Contracting Authority carries out new construction and rehabilitation of artificial grass pitches that are primarily used by different sports clubs in the municipality. In order to cover the need for delivery and installation of different artificial grass systems, the Contracting Authority shall enter into parallel framework agreements with 2 to 3 tenderers.
The number of pitches that are built and rehabilitated each year varies, but is normally around 2 to 3 new pitches and 5 to 10 rehabilitations.

This framework agreement shall cover delivery and installation of different artificial grass systems (with or without fill), and delivery of organic fill. The tenderer shall offer five different artificial grass systems that fulfil the requirements stated in the attached requirement specification.

The Contracting Authority has other framework agreements that cover engineering design of artificial grass pitches, ground works and light installations as well as removal and disposal of old artificial grass.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority has the option to extend the contract for up to 1 + 1 year on the same terms.

INFO_ADD.P: Regarding the ESPD form. The tenderers only need to complete section a in part IV, the and do not need to complete the other sections in part IV (A-D).

SUITABILITY.P: Requirement: Tenderers shall be a legally established company.
Documentation Requirements: Norwegian companies: Company registration certificate.
Foreign companies: Verification that the company is registered in a trade index or a register of business enterprises as prescribed by the law of the country where the company is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Credit evaluation/rating, not older than 6 months, and which is based on the last known accounting figures. The rating shall be carried out by a publicly approved credit rating institution.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to obtain a separate credit evaluation if necessary.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The tenderer must have the financial capacity to implement the contract.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: 1: An overview of the 5 most relevant deliveries and installation of artificial grass systems that the tenderer has carried out during the last 3 years, together with information about the contract value, delivery date and execution date and name of the recipient. See the tender documents point 3.4.

2: A description of the system for managing the supplier chain that the tenderer will use to carry out the contract. This comprises quality assurance measures that enable systematic follow up of the work with safeguarding basic human rights and ILO’s core conventions down the supplier chain/production process.

— A description of the tracking systems that the tenderer will use to fulfil the contract. The description must state methods and/or systems that enable tracking of the production locations and country of origin involved in the supplier chain for the goods in this contract. See section 3.5 of the tender documentation.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: 1: The tenderer shall have experience from delivering and installing artificial grass systems. See the tender documents point 3.4.

2: The tenderer is required to have implemented quality assurance measures that ensure that the tenderer is suited to fulfil the contractual obligations for social requirements (see the contract). This means that the tenderer has methods for managing the supplier chain and tracking systems that enable follow-up of compliance with.
— Basic human rights, including, amongst other things:
—— No person must be subjected to torture or gruesome, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 5).

—— All workers have the right to fa and good payment that ensures them and their family a dignified existence, and if necessary, complemented by other social protection (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 23.3).
—— Everyone has the right to rest and leisure time, including reasonable limiting of work hours and regular holidays with pay. (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 24).

—— ILO convention nº 138 and 182 (ban on discrimination), numbers 29 and 105 (ban on discrimination) and numbers 100 and 111 (ban on discrimination) and numbers 87 and 98 (freedom of association and right to collective bargaining). See section 3.5 of the tender documentation.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: The Contracting Authority sets the following requirements for installation leaders during installation of artificial grass systems.
— Installation leaders shall have experience from installation of artificial grass systems.
— Installation leaders shall be available at the installation site during the entire installation.
— Installation leaders shall be able to speak Norwegian or English.

The tenderer shall during the contract period, have representation in Norway that has administrative capacity to follow up awarded artificial grass projects both in the installation period and in the warranty period.
Tenderers shall have installation capacity to install three artificial grass systems at the same time.

INFO_ADD.P: A tender conference will be held for this competition 7.3.2018,10:00 - 12:00 at Karvesvingen 3, 0579 Oslo.
Tenderers are requested to submit any questions in advance so that the Contracting Authority has the opportunity to prepare the answers. Questions will be anonymous.
The minutes from the tender conference will be made available in KGV [the tender implementation tool].
Travel expenses etc. in connection with the tender inspection are to be covered by the individual service provider.
